page.title: 01Tay Valley Above Ballinluig
page.content: This block is largely covered by rough pasture and high level moorland with much of the high ground being used to pasture sheep. There is also a fair covering of coniferous trees both cultivated and wild. The farm crops grown here are few and contrast mainly of barley, wheat and potatoes. There is a low level amenity count and the main amenity is Balnaguard Inn. Which is an old building with a very small bar and a dinning room and meals are provided the clientele are mainly local farm and estate workers and in season sporting fishermen. A house further up river named Sketewan also appears to cater for sporting fishermen. Th ebus service on the roads across the area run on Tuesdays and Saturdays and the service alternates running on the north side of the river one service day and on
